I've never been a big fan of beat em ups or puzzle games, but everything about this one just felt... right somehow. All the soundtracks and voice acting are on point, and it has a distinct, colorful artstyle. Game mechanics are slowly introduced into the game, which was paced well.

The fighting mechanics are easy to understand and not too complex, while the cooking part, while also simple to understand, is much more challenging.

My only complaints are that this game clearly lacks a control scheme intended for mouse and keyboard, which took a while to get used to. That, and that the story, which I really enjoyed the writing and humor of, felt short. (10~ hours length)

Some people say that the combat is too easy, but I feel that extremely challenging combat was not the intention of the game design, as the point of hunting the monsters is not to defeat them, but to defeat them as quickly as possible to harvest ingredients and return to the cooking station. 

Thus, eventually you'll be able to defeat all the monsters on the map quickly. The penalty for being defeated in combat seem minimal, you drop all the ingredients you're carrying and get sent back to the cooking station. This gives the illusion that the combat is too easy. However, the game integrates both the fighting and the cooking into the "duel". Being defeated costs you precious seconds of time running back to where you were to get your ingredients back, and trust me, you will need every single second you can get during a duel.

37721810.review:
Nice little cooking game, except your ingredients are alive, you have to hunt them down first, they fight back viciously and can actually kill you. If that does not sound like one of the most hilarious premises for a game to you, find a mirror and take a deep look into your eyes, make sure your soul is still there.

Having an interesting premise is well and good, but can this game boast an equally great execution to match it?
Hell yeah it can!

At any given moment in your playthrough, you'll be doing one of the following things:

[list]
[*]Hunting monsters and gathering ingredients in sidescrolling hack'n'slash beat'em up platformer sections with a very competent combat system. It doesn't have the move variety of games like Bayonetta or DMC, of course, but with both physical and magical attack buttons triggering a different move depending on which directional button you're holding and whether or not you're in the air, two playable characters with unique move sets, and a decent variety of equippable customisation items, the amount of depth is [i]just right[/i] for what this game sets out to achieve!

[*]Putting all the ingredients you gather to use by preparing all sorts of wacky dishes in a deceptively simple gem-matching minigame. I say minigame, but given how much depth it gains through a gradually expanding set of rules and variables, there is actually nothing "mini" about it! You can choose to cook your dishes in a wide variety of different cookware, which completely alters the way taste gems interact with each other, opening up a huge potential for strategy!

[*]Exploring a tiny hub area, where you can buy cookware and numerous upgrades that will allow you to customise the way you fight and cook, take on little side-jobs that expand your knowledge of the game's systems and fill your wallet with coin, have a small chat with your friends and and random people on the street, and challenge your fellow aspiring battle chefs to the game's main event - a cook-off!

[*]And finally, you'll be following an incredibly charming, lighthearted and surprisingly well voice-acted story, which ties the aforementioned elements together, and is such a refreshing change from all the doom, gloom and grit permeating the modern game storytelling. Here you'll find no evil plots to destroy the world or enslave humanity, no vendetta missions against villains who killed your family. None of that tired old bollocks! There will be drama, there will be mystery and adventure, there will be friendships and rivalries, but at its core, this is just a story of one lovable girl's journey towards achieving her life's dream. And there ain't nothing wrong with that!
[/list]

This game's presentation made me fall in love with it from the very first minutes. Every aspect of it - the story, the characters, the music, the artstyle - can be described using one simple word: charming. Sure, it's got its flaws and quirks, like having to choose your loadout [i]before[/i] you actually know which conditions you'll be facing in a duel (thank god for a rematch option), some music tracks drowning out the dialogue, and from some backgrounds you can see that the artist was kinda struggling to keep up with the deadlines.

But all of those minor complaints get relentlessly crushed under the weight of tremendous amount of pure charm Battle Chef Brigade radiates. I simply can not imagine a better use for £15 I spent on it.

37675426.review:
[code] 本评测有所缩减。
    全文详见：https://cowlevel.net/game/Battle_Chef_Brigade/review/2847008[/code]

百年之前，怪物在大陆上肆虐。国王海因里希和他优秀的厨师侯布匈，一起拯救了这个濒临破灭的世界，并建立起了有史以来最为优秀的烹饪机构，选拔出进可杀敌退可烹饪的厨师士兵们，他们将同时肩负起保卫人民安全与肠胃的工作，他们就是Battle Chef Brigade，战斗厨师旅。

    这种充满了违和感的世界观设定只源于它是一款战斗烹饪游戏。不知是为了节约军费还是怎么，游戏中与怪物对抗的战士们需要同时具备优秀的烹饪技巧，每年首都都会有烹饪对决的选拔赛，最终的数名优胜者将成为Battle Chef Brigade中的一员。单单是烹饪与战斗这两个看似毫无关系的元素会被如何搭配组合，就足以让人充满好奇，而本作却不止于此，因为它还在这基础之上融入了三消元素。

本作将动作、烹饪、三消要素极具创意地结合一身，给人带来了相当惊艳的初体验。相比中规中矩的动作与战斗，游戏的主要重心放在了烹饪与三消上，但这种三消却不是枯燥的重复连线，而是在对决当中充满着选择与策略性的伪三消。在对决之外，游戏也为三消的剩余价值提供了解谜部分，让三消玩法充分得以发挥。

    为什么说烹饪对决当中的三消是伪三消呢？原因有两点：

    第一、三消的图案由食材固定产生，除非你在地图上不分对象到处乱打，否则你要面对的图案将不是随机或关卡固定的，而是自己想要什么图案，就去打什么怪。三消的玩法在于将多个相同图案排成一行，但如果画面上的图案全都一样，那还需要排吗？

    第二、对决时你一次三消都不进行，也能成功烹饪食材并获得胜利。

    这种玩法的核心在于本作烹饪器具当中的Crystallizer Oven（结晶炉），它可以缓慢克隆你放入锅内的水晶。而其它烹饪器具的作用，都是将同一排数个相同的水晶融合并升级，以提升菜肴当中的点数。

    相比传统烹饪器具，结晶炉完全无消耗，是一本万利的大买卖，只要在对决开始时将提前准备的最高级水晶放入锅内，等上4-5分钟就能充满整个大锅，使菜肴获得最高的点数。如果怕因为没有使用规定食材而扣分，完全可以在克隆到还剩三四个空位时，将规定的食材扔进空位去——无论哪一种，都不需要进行消除，也不需要进行连线。

[h1] 评价[/h1]

    规划，本作最让人印象深刻的还是规划。选择不同的装备、烹饪器具、辅助材料，以至于打什么怪，打多少，如何安排时间，先做什么后做什么菜——这些全都需要在了解评委口味和关卡地图的基础上做出规划，有时候你可能会因此而读档，因为一旦对决开始就不能更换物品。

    战斗系统你不能指望它太多。没有像样的Boss，打击判定略大，虽然可以进行连招，但大多数敌人十分弱小，对付它们完全不需要刻意连招，而Boss则完全不吃挑空。

    食材五花八门，菜肴效果上佳，配合三消系统确实让人感到了烹饪时的材料安排与紧迫感，不过一切的烹饪都只是为了获得点数，烹饪时的想象力将有所受限，想要在这种环境下做出黑暗料理也几乎不可能。



[h1]画面：9/10[/h1]

据说众筹的资金全都用在了美术和音乐上，效果可谓立竿见影。画风简洁、清爽、明亮，只凭截图也能迅速吸引眼球，在众多作品中脱颖而出。人物形象鲜明，造型多变，表情动作丰富。场景舒适感强，细节到位，相信应该不会有人对这款游戏的画面不满。


[h1]声音：9/10[/h1]

音乐质量很高，烹饪对决时的主旋律简单却又悦耳、深入人心，听过数遍之后很轻松就可以哼唱出来。剧情关键对话均有配音，声音对人物拿捏到位，更容易让人增加对角色的好感。


[h1]系统：7/10[/h1]

将三消成功完美融入到游戏当中，战斗与烹饪有着美妙的结合，但感觉烹饪系统还能再深挖。最终战结束得太过简单，关卡的安排没有针对性考验玩家的技巧。游戏中金钱的获得途径与总量都安排得太少，即便全数获得，也连商店里一半的东西都买不走，让人购物的心情全无，只能望着商品眼馋。最大的缺陷是大部分对决restart时无法重新选择道具，只能退出重新读档，而道具的选择却是对决中最重要的部分。战斗系统总体而言中规中矩，部分怪物会吃掉地上掉落的食材，这个设定很有意思。


[h1]游戏性：7/10[/h1]

游戏总时长约10-15小时，对于一个售价70元的游戏来说，勉强可以接受，但仍显略短。通关之后只能选择更高难度，无法使用通关存档自由游玩，也无法自由选择关卡及章节。每日挑战可以算是一个亮点，有排行榜，每日可以重复游玩，玩家还可以通过不断获胜获得经验值，提升自己的标识等级。挑战中的道具和评委口味均为固定，将进一步考验玩家的规划能力。



[h1]总评：8/10[/h1]

    这款游戏作为众筹作品，多少也有一点虎头蛇尾的意思，但绝赞的人设能够让你有一个非常不错的初期体验。不必因为三消而抱有偏见，事实上，它含有的传统三消元素真的不多。

11月26日現在
Xinputコントローラーでプレイすると左スティックの感度が悪いです。代わりに十字キーで操作していますが、システム上スティックありきなので改善をお願いします。
☆★☆★☆★☆★☆★☆★☆★

主人公ちゃんだけでなく、登場人物が皆個性的で超かわいいのでイラストに惚れたら買いです。
さてゲームの内容ですが、ざっくり言うと料理の大会に優勝することが目的です。

料理×パズル×バトルという今までにないジャンルですが、これが絶妙なバランスで素晴らしい。
基本上記の3つはシームレスに行います。
ありがちな「どの料理を作るか」「材料はこれでここでとって」「さてもう少し」…とかないです。
料理の時間だコラァ！！さっさと材料持ってこい！！あ？何ができるって！？そんなん完成したらわかる！いいから早くしろ！！！といったノリ。
いや、実際はゲームでこんなことは言われないんですが、つまりは「3つのことを一つの空間で行う」のでロードなどのストレスはありません。考えることがあるとしたらパズルの時くらいです。
パズルは難しくありません。縦横3列で並べて連鎖させるタイプのやつです。ぷ⚫ぷ⚫が得意な方はかなり好きなやつです。
戦闘は2Dグラフィックでありながらヌルヌル動き、難しい操作は必要ありません。
ですがすばやく敵を倒してすばやく材料拾って～とスピード勝負。何故なら料理バトルそのものに制限時間があるのでチンタラしてられないのです。パズルする時間がなくなります。
そして材料はなんでもいいというわけでもなく、大抵は指定されていて、それでいて審査員の好みに合った料理を作らなければなりません。
これだけ聞くと「めんどくせぇ」と思うかもしれませんが、不思議とそういったことは感じませんでした。
もしここで戦闘でロード入ってポコポコなぐるタイプだったらイライラしてたかもしれません。戦闘システムの爽快感がうまく相殺してくれています。
何より面白いのは出来上がった料理。とんでもないゲテモノ材料から美味しそうなものが完成します。飯テロです。
様々な材料とパズルの組み合わせで完成するものは変わるのでそういった楽しみも素晴らしいです。

余談ですが、こちらのゲーム、意外な場所に小ネタがチラホラあります(笑)
例えばチュートリアルで★50(クオリティ)の料理を作ることになりますが、完成していない状態のまま出したり、目標達成してるにも関わらず無視して更なるクオリティを求めようとすると追加の会話が発生したりします。
その他にも調べられるギミックやら色々あるので余裕のある時は少し天の邪鬼になるのもありかと思います。

37605943.review:
Average Recommendation

Disclaimer: I kickstarted this game.

Battle Chef Brigade is a very well done fusion of puzzle and action game elements with a lighthearted story and some animation and scenario issues.  Its greatest strength is the interactions between the loadout and the gameplay where what you bring and what you plan to do is actually very important.  The main weakness is the amount of re-used content, there only being three-and-a-half levels.

The combat is fluid and the levels are well designed but conversely the animations and hitboxes could be better and the same can be said of the platforming; it'll often look like you've gotten on top of something only to slip back through. The voice acting is very good even if there are a lot of animation shortcuts such as your opponents often not having run cycles and just sliding the other way at the start of the match.  Still, the backgrounds and monsters all look nice and ultimately it all gets the job done.

I don't think I've ever played anything quite like Battle Chef Brigade and I thought it was worth the wait and beta testing.  It's a little rough around the edges, but it does what it sets off to do and it all comes together in a nice simmering stew.

37555075.review:
Порой наталкиваешься на ситуацию, когда вокруг пары простых идей крутится все геймплейное ядро игры...и черт побери - делает это хорошо.

[h1]Графика:[/h1]

Очень приятная глазу ручная рисовка с легкой примесью аниме - стиля. Повествовательная часть игры хоть и не блещет анимированностью, но хорошо передает настроение сцен. "Боевая часть" сделана отлично, в движении все смотрится выверенно и четко.

[h1]Звук:[/h1]

Темы ОСТа идеально сопровождают происходящее, будь то экшен или "повседневность". Озвучка годная, хоть и не слишком выделяется.

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]

Алмаз игры, зародившийся из пары простых идей. 

Не буду рассказывать про повествование, ибо выборов мы никаких в нем не делаем, а лишь следим за ходом событий. 
Стоит сказать, что созданная вселенная, где для борьбы с монстрами образована бригада боевых поваров, которые из монстрятинки готовы сделать шербет в прямом смысле слова - гениальна. Игра прекрасно передает соревновательный дух за место среди лучших на манер Shokugeki no Soma, но с фентезийным уклоном.

Экшен - часть можно поделить на две составляющие: бой и паззл.

Хотите драконий стейк? Или слаймовое мороженное? Может сашими из гидры? Пожалуйста! Доставайте верный нож и идите кромсать местную фауну...притом боевка сделана до безобразия простой, но с потрясающей глубиной. Чего уж там, игра позволяет выделывать зрелищные цепочки воздушных комбо и это все зиждется на четырех кнопках + стрелках движения. К слову, геймпад отлично заходит... 

Сложность боя тоже растет...со временем появляются более опасные монстры, а старые мутируют, приобретая колоссальный урон и другие мерзкие трейты (чертовы чипчики...).

Не отстает и паззл часть...вот мы собрали ингредиенты, каждый выступает набором цветов для всем известной "три в ряд". Задача проста - сделай блюдо, которое понравится конкретному судье. Притом каждый предпочитает определенные "нотки вкуса", а потому блюда приходится делать разные. Но дальше начинают наслаиваться дополнительные механики...появляются блоки костей, хрупкие вкусовые камни, которые при частом "помешивании" блюда развалятся и яд, портящий все вокруг. 

Не отстает и прогрессия персонажа. Дело в том, что нам выдано 9 ячеек под снаряжение: три для пассивных боевых баффов, три доп. ингредиента или техники приготовления, повышающих итоговый рейтинг блюда, три ячейки под кухонную утварь...и тут Вам тоже целый ассортимент со своими плюсами и минусами: духовка, томилка, сковородки, чаши, разделочная доска и т.д.. Подобрать свой стиль приготовления легко и сложно одновременно...

Пара слов о сложности: не стоит думать, что хард как-то просто проходится поначалу...к середине рассказа начнут попадаться повара, которые с легкостью готовы вмять Вас лицом в землю...притом с ошеломительной разницей рейтинга блюда. Моя наивность была разбита просто эпично...

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

За внешней простотой скрывается увлекательный и даже челенджовый геймплей, все это под соусом из шикарной атмосферы, стиля и хорошего звука.

Мне лично не хватает одного - мультиплеера...и он тут идеально бы встроился....Только представьте - "настоящие" кулинарные поединки на время с рандомными условиями... 

Моя оценка: 9 из 10. Почти шедевр в своем контексте...пару штрихов, мультиплеер и можно записывать в "идеальные" творения.

Equal parts puzzle game and hack n' slash platformer, Battle Chef Brigade is one of the best games I have played in years.

Every time you feel like you are used to the puzzle elements, the game throws another bit of complexity into the mix. 37545162.review:
An amazingly fun and beautiful game that only has one fault: it isn't long enough, and the story is a little brief as a result. I kinda wish this game is three times bigger than it is places to explore that isn't in the arena. There also seems to be parts of the map that aren't used, which makes me suspect that a DLC is incoming or they devs didn't manage to push out that part of the content in time.

The game is unbelievably beautiful though, and the music is melodious. The characters are cool, and I kinda wished I got to play Kirin. Trash is a damn good fighter and Mina is pretty dodgy, and I'm curious to see how Kirin fight. At the end of the story it's kinda hinted that our main characters went out on team missions, which is something I really, really wanted to see but unfortunately won't get in this game at least (maybe in a sequel, but it's also hinted then it'll be the next generation who will be the focus...).

Combos can be easily chained, although I gotta complain that Mina's range is really short. I have to stand - on screen - maximum 1 ~ 2 centimeter away from the enemy or I can't hit anything. Personally I detest time limits but that's completely subjective; Practice Mode is always available if you wish to play without worrying over that.

Again, this easily could give Pyre a run for their money if it was longer. I absolutely recommend this game, and I absolutely urge the devs to eventually plan for a sequel for this game. Will buy it without hesitation. :D

I was initially disappointed when I found out this was going to be a match-three game, but it turns out that it's a lot of fun.

Pros:
- Great match-three game implementation.
- Artstyle, I personally enjoy the "rough sketch"-style. The food looks really good.
- Good Tutorial, the game slowly trains you with the side-missions and makes a natural introductions of new mechanics.

Cons:
- Relatively few ingredients on each map. Could benefit from a bit more variation.
- Should have a mode without time limits to make the game more available.

The story is fine imo, you're not really invested in the main character or the story but I don't feel like that's very important. It's a puzzle highscore game. The story is there to introduce new mechanics in the game and adjust the learning curve which it does very well. 

Is it worth your money? Maybe. I've been following this game for over a year and just had to buy it (it's shokugeki no soma + Toriko the game). I would say it's worth $15-20, so it's not overpriced but you might want to wait for a sale.

The characters themselves are fine. The design for each one is interesting but their personalities are pretty bland. Because if anything happens to her, the story is just going to make something up so it goes right for her again without her doing anything. Nothing in the story feels like it has any weight. If you fail a competition, you can do a rematch (which makes me wonder why even bother with the timer). If you don't serve everybody in the resturant for your side-job, you still get paid for just standing there. 

Its fun to try out, but I recommend waiting for the game to go on sale. I got this game by backing it on Kickstarter.

37411286.review:
Para aqueles que quiserem quiserem conferir um gameplay mais detalhado do jogo, considere se inscrever no meu canal do Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/203719362

Este jogo chegou em boa hora para que eu o indicasse como jogo difícil de descrever no Steam Awards. Battle Chef Brigade é tudo aquilo que eu esperava e mais um pouco de um jogo com temática culinária e a Adult Swim Games continua de parabéns por descobrir e publicar títulos tão legais!

O jogo é basicamente um sidescrolling beat'em-up match-3-puzzle visual novel. Sim, ele inclui elementos de pancadaria e caça de ingredientes que você leva de volta para a sua despensa e depois utiliza para cozinhar através de um quebra-cabeças por combinação de três. Toda a história do jogo é apresentada como um romance visual e isso me impressionou porque ele é bem escrito, na quantidade certa de diálogo e não é massante como a maioria dos jogos desse gênero é. O ponto alto do jogo é a escolha dos equipamentos para enfrentar os outros chefs e agradar os juízes que tem gostos específicos, além de que cada prato precisa seguir uma temática para não perder metade dos pontos. Existem itens para melhorar/facilitar os combos (frigideiras), para mudar (temperos), remover (tábua de carne) ou melhorar (panelas) as peças, etc. É possível jogar com a personagem principal ou com o orc, cada um com o seu estilo (vento e fogo respectivamente).

Creio que a soma de vários ingredientes num mesmo título não estragou a receita (com o perdão da piada), pelo contrário eles estão distribuídos de tal forma e com uma progressão tão agradável que o resultado é uma história envolvente com mecânicas divertidas e que ainda exigem estratégia e planejamento por parte do jogador para conseguir o máximo de pontos possíveis nas disputas do que essencialmente trata-se de um belíssimo simulador de Master Chef.

O estilo manga de Battle Chef Brigade é bonito e mostra que Chicago conta com artistas competentes do gênero. Existe uma grande variedade de pratos e ingredientes que se combinam no jogo formando as refeições mais bizarras que um cenário medieval fantástico poderia oferecer. Parece que os útimos dois anos foram a era dos jogos culinários de qualidade e quem sabe até quando isso vai continuar?

A música do jogo é muito boa, mas às vezes fica mais alta do que os diálogos e portanto eu recomendo que você já ajuste isso de imediato.

O jogo conta com desafios e placares de líderes que como de costume incluem pontuações absurdas no topo.

Além de uma disputa diária que coloca em teste suas habilidades, num jogo que no início você vai fazer em média 250 pontos, ver um placar em que os líderes estão com 800 pontos com certeza faz você repensar as suas técnicas.

CONCLUSÃO: O jogo vale cada centavo com ou sem desconto e vai te prender por horas (ou mesmo até o final já que são 6 capítulos bem longos) de tão divertido e desafiante que ele é.

37282934.review:
Battle Chef Brigade is a hectic combination of match 3 games, platforming, and Monster Hunter tied up together with a quirky plot and fun characters. The gist of the main part of the game is: you're given an enemy you must use or suffer a large penalty, you go out and hunt monsters in an action platformer, collect their parts to use as ingredients, and then cook the ingredients too perfection using a surprisingly in depth match 3 game in order to present them to up to 3 judges, each having their own preferences. 

The action platforming part of the game is rough around the edges. The combat felt fairly unsatisfying, as monsters didn't have any sort of tell as to when they attacked, leaving the game to be all about timing when fighting a large monster such as a Hydra or a Dragon. 

The cooking part, however, is very fun. While it starts off slow, it quickly becomes pretty hectic as you have to manage multiple ingredients together, while being pressured with a time limit that goes by faster than you'd think. This is accompanied by small taunts between you and your competitor which give the game a lot of flavor. The game also managed to stay fresh by constantly adding new items to the shop that can give bonuses depending on certain conditions being met. There's a vast amount of items you can use to change your loadout, making optimizing it very fun.

The game, however, seems to be fairly short, but this is mitigated by their daily cook-offs adding re-playability to the game. While playing on normal mode, I encountered a few difficulty spikes compared to the rest of the game, but never really felt frustrated, usually breezing through my opponents even when playing poorly. 

Battle Chef Brigade rewards experimentation, and presents a fairly open approach to the game. It's perfectly viable to exclusively cook with vegetables and never do any fighting. If you don't want to deal with some of the Match 3 mechanics, you can buy items to nullify them. It's very open in how you play the game.

Overall though, $20 is definitely worth it for this title, and I'd recommend it if you find any interest in it. Don't expect a robust combat system, but puzzle game fans will love this.

37221829.review:
Battle Chef Brigade is a fantastic game, but it's rough around the edges. The strengths of the game are in its charming writing, art, and in the cooking gameplay. Its weaknesses would be in polish: combat animations, saving, and characters outside of Mina being shallow archetypes. Given the price point and the resources that went into Battle Chef Brigade, I think these flaws can be overlooked. At the very least, Battle Chef Brigade provides a strong base to season later with DLC or updates. 

There are also a few small, non-gamebreaking, bugs that I encountered throughout the game: performance occassionally dropped, a link to a Trello card was overlayed on the top of my screen, and during a certain event a super annoying buzzing sound starts playing. It does go away, however, and not too big of a deal. Also, achievements do not seem to track as well as they should. I have no idea when I missed a puzzle and given I'm at 0/30, I have no idea how many I missed either.

Despite being a fan of the writing and art, I can't say there is much to write about. Characters had nuance when the writers could afford it, but most ended up being fun archetypes or personalities. The onesthat we spent the most time with were lovable and relatable. Nearly every character was grounded in some way and the dialogue felt real for characters that were expected to feel real, and out of this world for those that were obviously just cool designs. The narrative was less thought-provoking and more feel-good given the people you defeated were nearly always on your side to begin with. It reads like the third or fourth arc of an anime and achieves its goal of giving you people to root for and giving simple narrative conflicts to resolve through battle and cooking. 

At the end of the day, what makes Battle Chef Brigade a fantastic game is the cooking. Throughout the game Battle Chef Brigade introduces new gem types, restrictions, and cooking utensils. Your restricted loadout meant that how you played was tied to what tools you decided to bring to that match. The progression system and having to purchase items at the shop meant that how you played consistently evolved until you reached your style of cooking. That keeps gameplay fresh. 

Every match is also different as different judges have different tastes and you have to work with the theme ingredient on top of everything else. Given you choose a loadout before seeing the theme & tastes, it's also better to create a loadout that can work around these restrictions. Add in a time limit in Hard -- the timer is integral to a feeling of tension -- and you kind of create a sub-game of optimization within the main game.

To that end, I think Battle Chef Brigade manages to create a fresh core gameplay loop that rewards creativity and experimentation. I changed my loadouts multiple times until I eventually settled on a set of expertise books that were easy and consistent to trigger. Since the opponents were not super challenging (I only lost once and swept most of my opponents with ease), I was never really afraid of losing. Instead, I focused on how many points I could score in a given challenge. There is a strong sense of satisfaction that stems from having a dish that matches the flavour, theme, and triggers multiple cooking expertise conditions.

My main criticism outside of polish would be that the core combat loop felt unsatisfying. The animations for the monsters lacked fluid tells that I am accustomed to from games like Monster Hunter or Dark Souls. Fighting monsters became a lot of timing rather than reacting to their movements. Perhaps that was a design choice, but I felt frustrated whenever I had to fight a dragon or a hydra. Animations are less of an issue with monsters that you can combo and kill at your own leisure. You have complete agency as a player there.

What is great about Battle Chef Brigade is that you have the choice to avoid the parts you do not like. If you do not like fighting, using mostly vegetables is completely viable. If you don't like dealing with restrictions like bones or poison, you can work around them through different cooking utensils. While there are no narrative choices, the way you choose to play the game is pretty open.

37127687.review:
I was a Kickstarter backer for the basic game tier and I’m really having a good track record with these. 

Battle Chef Brigade is a fusion of multiple genres, it’s a side-scrolling action game crossed with a Match 3 puzzle game and some light RPG elements. This gameplay combination works quite well; the action segments where you hunt monsters for ingredients controls smoothly and are fun and the Match 3 parts where you cook your ingredients are good too. Though fair warning if you can’t do Match 3 at a swift clip you might run into some trouble towards endgame of the campaign, I barely managed to squeak by the final boss on Normal so I don’t ever plan on playing Hard.  I’ve only run into one annoying bug, an audio bug that persisted throughout most of a match. I had to mute the game, but it corrected itself once I won the match.

The writing is quite good, mainly in that the characters are charming and they are bolstered by some real quality voice-acting. The game also has a conclusive ending too. The atmosphere is also great, it’s lively and colorful. The game’s art design is reminiscent of Miyazaki or Wakfu and it has that painting-like quality to it. The character design is quite good too, ranging from a young girl with a teapot robot, an undead necromancer with his ghost slime buddy, and a few different kinds of orc.

Battle Chef Brigade is a unique game with a lot of heart that’s definitely worth checking out.

36984683.review:
I don't write reviews for games, but this game deserves every bit of time and love I can give it.
Full disclosure: I backed this game on Kickstarter about 4 years ago I believe, long before Adult Swim picked it up.

Battle Chef Brigade is a cooking, hack n' slash side-scrolling fantasy game, that sounds like a series of random buzzwords that most publishers would throw around on Twitter without saying it aloud and realizing it sounds dumb, however that's the best way I can describe BCB. You gather ingredients from slaying monsters and then put the elements of those ingredients together in a match-3 style puzzle game. For anyone who has seen an episode of Chopped should be able to pick up pretty quickly that there are judges and these judges have certain requests and the overall host gives you a theme ingredient that he would like to see as apart of your dish. 

The story is solid, if a tad disjointed toward the end as it flip-flops from one protagonist to another. That being said the voice acting and characters are excellent with each character looking and sounding distinct and having likable memorable personalities from each other. The music is also really solid with inspiration from both fantasy and French styles. The art is solid and hand-drawn but this occasionally will cause issues. Characters rarely ever "move" and some characters even lack a walking animation (some will slide off screen which is unintentionally hilarious to me). That being said it's well used in most cutscenes and the voice acting is superb enough to help overlook these issues.

I streamed this game from it's launch and everyone who watched was absoluetly blown away by the level of quality this tiny team acheived on a small percentage of your typical Mighty No.9 campaign. I wholeheartedly reccomend this title at full price, you'll find plenty to offer on hand here at launch and there's no bugs or glitches I've come across as of yet.

(I apologize for the review sounding a bit ramble-y, it's been several years since I've done a written review)

36938416.review:
At eight hours I just beat this game and I have to say that was the most fun eight hours I've had in a long time. Battle Chef Brigade is best described as Monster Hunter meets Iron Chef meets Combo-based side scrolling.

In the game you play as Mina Han, a talented chef and fighter who is skilled with wind magic, who dreams of becoming a Battle Chef. A battle chef is basically a chef that uses their skills not only to fight dangerous monsters but to either research their ingredents or use it to cook with.

The story is well made with a full cast of colorful characters that each make the world feel alive and gives it a sort of charm. From the side characters like Master hunter Thorn or the cat-obsessed scientist Belchoir to the main cast like the brave Orc warrior Thrash and the intelligent Kirin, each one makes the world feel unique and fun to experience.

Now onto the game itself, it's pretty story heavy which is a huge plus in my opinion but the mechanics are pretty simple. During matches you need to hunt down monsters in specific areas to harvest the ingredents you need to finish a dish, this is where the Iron Chef part comes in. The matches are judged by a panel of 1-3 judges and each have a specific element or mixture of elements they want and they have a theme ingredent. 

The voice acting can feel a bit amateurish at times but overall it was really well down for an indie game, I kinda let that one slide because again, it's an indie game.

Mechanics of the game are extremely solid and it is really fun to play around with.

My one complaint is that the game is a little on the short side but I'm hopeful that we'll see more from Trinket Studios as this game is truely a gem.

I highly recommend this game, again it is the most fun I've had in months and I think I will come back to replay this a lot of times.

Vive la Brigade Battle Chefs!

I Kickstarted the campaign for this game back last year and have been looking forward to it ever since. Many of the reviews here have already explained and given this title the priase it deserves, but I'd like to add my input as well.

I'd like to note that I've so far only got to day 3 as Mina and I'm playing through the game in the standard difficulty.

+ The Art Style is gorgeous.
+ The Voice Acting suits each individual character.
+ The Storyline is well thought out.
+ The Cooking Puzzles are fun and can become challenging.
+ The Combat is entertaining and somewhat challenging.
+ The Musical score suits each level / stage / setting that it is precented on.

The Negative:
- I cannot find an instruction screen to refresh my memory on how to do x, and y. (I have a short memory, so if I do not complete or play the game daily I'll have issues).
- Unable to change your loadout within a match.

My personal opinion regarding the loadout is that it should be chosen once you see your judges to make it more situational, having the loadout before makes more sense in the hard difficulty of the game, however, your loadout may not match what your chef desires and you may end up stuck not being able to please them on later stages.

If you like match puzzles, sidescrolling combat and entertaining stories then look no further than Battle Chef Brigade.

Highly Recommend.

総評すると、値段相応の小さくまとまった作りですが中心となる料理部分には光るものがあるゲームです。アーケード的なノリでトライ＆エラーを繰り返すのを楽しめる方にはおすすめします。

36683644.review:
A game that I've been looking forward to for quite some time and I have to confess it did not dissapoint.

It's a wonderful looking game with an art-style all it's own, eye popping visuals draw you into not only the delightful looking food, but into some very unique and endearing characters also. No two NPC's look alike (save Luis and Louie but those two kind of have an excuse) and no two dishes will look alike either. The story- currently on chapter 3 of 6- has been far more than I expected it to be.

It's not simply- Show up and fight to make the best dish. The game is peppered with, dare I say, lore to entice. The backgrounds are highly interactable, the npc's all have little concurrent running stories and with the way the first 3 chapters are forumlated you'll be spoiled for learning more/less depending on how many times you challenge a certain foe. Replay value is most certainly there.

Add a dash of daily challenges, puzzles, matching games and new plot elements that make the match 3 gameplay change on the fly. Items matter, how you spend your meagre cash matters and just when you think you've figured it all out you'll run into a judge who isn't SWAYED by your ULTRA SPICY DRAGON WING SUPREME HOT SAUCE- prudes and fools i say- and you'll need to adapt on the fly.

I'm not the biggest fan of match 3 games but with the strange items you can get- only needing to match 2 of a colour in elemental pans, special sauces to change the colours of all your ingrdients, special crockery designed to turn a set of weak ingridients into high powered ones- I was kept enticed. Every time my dishes star rank went up I beamed and every time it went down I silently hoped my competition was murdered by one of the many delightful critters that populate the hunting maps.

Yet to happen sadly.

In case it's not obvious I've been bowled over by the strong mix of flavours and elements the game has- I'm stretching the food imagery here so let me wrap up with some criticisms.

I confess that it's a little annoying to only get 1 practice map, despite there being more than 1 hunt arena. I'd have liked a little more chance to alter my items. As I said you can spec into fire ingridients, fire pans and fire sauces but when you go into the arena it's locked down and unchangable. It rather sucks to come in ready to be the next Guy Fieri, lord of Hot Sauce, only to find I'm serving an old lady who wants a WATERY dish.

I dare say there's something to be said of making sure you can't insta-lock a judge 100% but it's a bit awkward to kit yourself out for a certain flavour and find out it's not showing up. I dare say if you memorize all the dates and all teh challenges you can get around this but that sounds a bit daft.

Lastly I remember reading there's supposed to be 5 playable chefs. So far there are 2 and others have mentioned the other characters lacking. I can only assume they will show up later, as their goals were met. This doesn't upset me personally but some people like to know they're getting everything they were promised.

Regardless the game is very fun and an utter feast for the eyes. Okay I'm done with the food jokes now, stuffed this review full of them.

-SPOILERS BELOW-


So, having completed Mina's arc, I have to say the difficulty feels, weird. (on hard) Suddenly having 3 back to back challenges. And the fact you are sort of punished for preparing for challenge 1, into 2, then 3. But once I had my items properly set I did challenge 3 in my first run. Which made it feel awkward. 

And then bam, start all over, same rules, but now you're someone else. The chapter system is also a bit weird since it feels like the chapters should have been more like. Book1 Chapter 1-X.

Still over all enjoying it, but I really dislike how the new character plays currently. Feels off from the combat you start out with.

36670167.review:
[h1][b]Es justamente el juego que estaba esperando.[/b][/h1] 
Battle Chef Brigade es divertido, emocionante, cuenta una buena historia, tiene desafíos y por sobre todo, es un producto "simple" que logra sorprender. Las voces me gustaron. La música me encanto, tan de orquesta, hecha para un concurso, perdón... ¡una batalla! (jaja). La traducción al español esta bien. Me asuste al principio (con los graficos), pero está muy bien presentado, disfrutenlo. Es un juego de estilo anime, con puzzles. Cocinas comidas cazando monstruos y juntando ingredientes, todo eso en tiempo real. Es sólido, lo recomiendo.

[h1][b]¿Que bugs y errores encontre?[/b][/h1]
Hay una pequeña falla en la sincronización vertical, los FPS pueden fallar. Puede que corra mal o se vea mal. Yo encontre dicho error "pasable" "no me molesto" pero quería mencionarlo. También es cierto que hay un crash durante el capítulo 3.

[h1][b]Nota Final: 8/10[/b][/h1]
Precio accesible. Jugabilidad Flexible. Narra bien una historia que es simple y atractiva. Está traducido al español (voces en inglés). El texto se puede ajustar a tamaños más grandes. Y sin duda la mejor parte no es solo el diseño de personajes o el arte del juego, pero sino también la música, la cual me trajo recuerdos del juego "Princess Maker 2". Yeah!!,

[h1][b]Siempre quise ver la saga de Cooking Mama en PC[/b][/h1]
Pero ahora tenemos Battle Chef Brigade y es sensacional.

[h1][b]El juego en detalle[/b][/h1]
+Tenes el [u][b]MODO HISTORIA[/b][/u] con 6 capítulos.
+Modo de juego "[u][b]DESAFÍO[/b][/u]" donde trabajas en un restaurante cocinando platillos para los clientes. Tiene modo de dificultad fácil y difícil. (Es raro que no tenga dificultad "normal")
+Modo de juego "[u][b]CONCURSO DIARIO[/b][/u]" donde competis contra otro Chef (de evento).  Cuenta con una tabla de Ranking Online y un sistema de progresión para destacar el nivel de tu perfil. Empezas nivel Cuchara, luego Espada, etc, etc.
+El tema de los Puzzles y cocinar puede ser abrumador al principio y el modo historia sirve justamente para enseñarte desde lo básico hasta lo avanzado. (Comida, Salsas, Todo bien explicado)
+No solo cazas monstruos, también mejoras tu personaje. (al menos a Mina al principio) La podes equipar con diferentes armas y objetos que la ayudan no solo a combatir pero sino también a preparar la comida más deliciosa. No solo estás cazando monstruos y recolectando ingredientes. Podes dejar cosas en la estufa y que se mejoren automáticamente. Es un sistema de puzzle "básico" que se vuelve más complejo pero divertido.
+Cada batalla es en tiempo real. Es importante medir el tiempo entre cazar, obtener ingredientes y volver a la cocina a preparar la comida.
+Tenemos un "[u][b]Modo Libre[/b][/u]" (Free Roam) donde podemos practicar libremente nuestros talentos como chef. El problema del Free Roam es que no hay jueces y es solo en el área del bosque. (Desconozco si podremos ir a otras áreas como sucede en el modo historia).
+La historia se desarrolla en una ciudad con trabajos y pequeñas historias (side quest). Todo en beneficio a Mina y como evoluciona como personaje. ¡es Genial! 
+La ciudad está llena de Gatitos!!! Meow!!!

Shortly after that same bird was eaten by a plant that sprouted wings after snacking down on the little guy.

Let me start out by saying that I love the gameplay in this game. They also do a great job of introducing new mechanics over time that throw a wrench into the formula and shake up the way you have to think about the puzzles.

HOWEVER there is one thing that is honestly ruining my enjoyment of the game so far. You get a ton of interesting themed cookware that could be useful in the right situation. 36669157.review:
清新可人的日式动漫画风让这款美国人做的游戏显得格外特别。而在唯美清丽的画面之下，游戏却有着一个残酷而沉重的世界观——怪兽横行，人间涂炭，饥饿和死亡笼罩着Victusia大陆已有百年。因此，为了抵御邪恶生物的侵袭，为了人民安居乐业的生活，一群才能超卓，热衷烹饪的能人异士缔结组织”Battle Chef Brigade（战斗厨师旅团）“，一同狩猎怪物，保家护国，顺便用怪物身上的食材磨练厨艺，切磋比拼。

游戏的核心玩法是”战斗三消“。平台动作阶段搜集食材（三消素材），三消阶段则烹饪食物。在限定时间内，权衡阶段利弊，猎取筛选合适食材（三消素材），以累积更高的三消分数，再综合菜品制作要求，获得最终评分。游戏既动手又动脑，简直是益智练手的绝佳选择。游戏的战斗手感干脆利落，打击感清脆爽快，并且有难度选择，适宜各类人群体验。

主观不足：背景较为呆板，非主角人物缺乏动作表现，细节一般（1.2小时）。后续观感如何，还需深入体验。

36652090.review:
In a world where 30-40 new Steam game come out everyday, and most of these are either asset flips, zombie games or the same game re-skinned and renamed, it's more than a little refreshing to have a genuinely new and original title! While this probably will remind some of Food Wars or a similar anime, the presentation is fresh enough  to really stand on it's own merit. (Video Version of Review) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tK4w5QhP53k&t=22s

The game is simple in it's parts: 

-Overworld Map
-6 Chapters
-Interactive Towns
-Side Scrolling Combat 
-Ingredients and Gear Collection
-Tile Matching Cooking System 
-Graded Cooking Duels
-Charming Story and Character Interactions
-Hybrid Anime Art Style

These components mix together as beautifully as you'll hope your first dish in the game turns out. The funny thing here is that most game want you to be invested in your character, but rarely does that ever happen for me. However, Mina is such a likable and relatable character that I found myself instantly drawn to her and her quest to become a chef extraordinary. The combat, while simple, is fun, fast, and varied, the cooking is simple in concept and execution, but ramps up nicely as more specific ingredients and compositions are required. There is also a daily challenge mode, as well as a cooking mode, and combat mode; all of which give nice distractions from the main quest line. Make no mistake this is an RPG at it's core, so if reading and character focus are a turn off for you then you may want to hold off on purchasing. At the end of the day this is a title that has been exquisitely crafted and will offer and engaging story matched by awesome gameplay.

36651455.review:
Battle Chef Brigade is an interesting rpg/match 3 style game with rich backgrounds and fun mechanics. Originally a kickstarted game, it has some great gameplay mechanics.

Players are control Mina, a contestant in the Battle Chef Tournament. You'll have to gather your own ingredients during matches by killing monsters or harvesting from bushes. Each item you collect has different qualities to it, which affect how easily it can be combined with other ingredients.

The match 3 part of the game comes into play when you start cooking, adding ingredients to the pot. Simply adding ingredients won't make them upgrade into tier 2 or tier 3 qualities, but moving the pot onto the fire and cooking/stirring the ingredients will. But certain pots will allow for easier combinations, like match 2 instead; though these pots are usually limited to only working on 1 type of color. The colors are blue, green, and red; so there isn't as much complexity as other match 3 games.

Most matches have a time limit, and judges with specific "taste" preferences which will score more or less points depending on what your board looks like.

The background/environment is very soothing, and all the diversity in the character designs is very nice. The music compliments the overall game very nicely as well. Besides that, there are some downsides. Changing the resolution can take a bit of time since it requires you to go through all the resolutions from lowest to highest.

39384644.review:
You are Mina, a young chef aspiring to be a chef brigade. She can use wind magic and is a well known chef from her small village. She manages to get into the competition to become a chef brigade, and that is where your adventure really starts off.

This game takes place in a world that's like a chef-themed Hunter x Hunter. You will learn how to fight beasts, and then cook their remains like 5 seconds after slaughtering them. A world where people get overwhelmed by monsters and their biggest issue is apparently lacking food and don't think of just killing the monsters for food for a couple hundred years. So once they grow some balls, they eventually ate monsters and went "oh cool lets make an entire society based on chefs that both kill and cook," and so it happened.

Ok as you can tell the story isn't very well thought out, but as a person who's overly critical about games, even I could let this slide as the game's strength is its gameplay. Like previously mentioned, you fight beasts, then cook with their remains as the main game. You go into competitions where you go head-to-head with another chef. If you win the competition, you become a hunter... I mean a chef brigade. Same thing, but a little less cool, and only about cooking really.

The cooking is very clever honestly. It uses match 3 games as a method to explain cooking and it does really fucking well. You can combine ingrediants up to level 3. Leveling up ingrediants gives you more points on each dish. There are 3 types of flavors, fire, water, and earth. So while just combining random ingrediants is easy, like the AI does most of the time, you won't get the max amount of points you would want to get if you don't focus on the judge's flavor and the theme ingrediant, which is selected at the start of every match. And obviously, you want the most points to win.

Now flavors and theme ingrediants are important to how the combat works, as what you fight, and sometimes how you fight it, depends on what you need. This combination is amazing honestly. There is real tension in each match, and you are constantly trying to find out what to get next for your meal.

It's a great game, my only warning is that the characters and story is more than a bit bland at the beginning. Give it time and the game really picks up. Sadly it ends in around 10 hours, but it was a very fun experience that took this game into my top 5 games of 2017. Really hope more content is released for this game as the arcade content like break the targets or daily challenges aren't enough to hold me over.

39264476.review:
This is a really wonderful game and I feel it needs a lot more recognition.

It's a very unique mix of a sidescrolling action game and a cleverly done match-3 system wrapped around the idea of "battle chefs" dueling each other. In these duels you're supposed to outdo your opponent at appealing to the judges' tastes and requirements by hunting down monsters for specific ingredients and cooking them in various ways. It creates a very nice sense of tension without being difficult for the most part. There's also a bunch of optional minigames you can participate in to spice it up.

There's about 10 hours worth of the story mode and it never really drags on and the characters are all pretty neat and light-hearted. Once you're done with that, you can also try the daily battles or challenges and from what I've heard the devs (who are very active on the forums) are planning updates with more playable characters in the future.

The artstyle is great, all of the mechanics are super tight and it's just really fun to play. But I think it's the unique premise and concept which separate Battle Chef Brigade from other games.



[i]On a sidenote, I've played it through on a keyboard and while you can rebind the keys to your liking, it definitely feels like the game was designed to be played with a controller. Not too big of an issue, though.[/i]

39151802.review:
Just a little pick-me-up during sales (except this one wasn't on sale), I was curious about this game for quite some time and boy did I have a blast playing it. Battle Chef Brigade is a brawler/puzzle game that has all the strong points in all the right places.

First off, let's start with the artwork. This, for me, being an aspiring artist, really caught my eye. The character designs were well-drawn, the colorful water-color style was something spectacular. If you're reading this devs, please release a concept art compilation of this game DLC, I would gladly throw in some extra bucks on it. 

For the gameplay, let's start with the puzzle aspect. The game's puzzle mechanic uses mainly a match 3 puzzles, and each puzzle range from easy to ball-bustingly hard. Each puzzle had some interesting twists including bones, taking out poison, and even fragile gems that break if you mismatch a number of turns. It took me a while to get around these, but all of them were all rewarding. Another mechanic is that you can improve your puzzles by equipping items, and upgrades on your loadout, to handle your style of cooking.

The brawler aspect kinda troubles me a bit, I'm 50/50 about this one so bear with me. While the beat-em-up part of the game plays smooth with simple yet stylish animations, I can't help but feel its repetitiveness at the later part of the game. Mostly the beat-em-up section's objective is to forage ingredients from Monsters and Flora, which was interesting enough to carefully pick your hitlist depending on the challenge objectives. If only the game also included character progression and skill trees and not just having to rely on your loadouts, the brawler section would have been better.

And the story, I think the story, although simple, has some moments. Above average, I should say. You have a wonderful set of colorful, loveable and memorable characters; all professionally voice-acted. While the plot was simple, the characters really sold it for me. 

And of course, the grand high-fantasy setting was something to behold. Kinda reminded me of Dragon Age Origins or maybe Avatar: The Last Airbender with the way they handled the setting and characters.

Overall, I could not recommend this game enough. Go ahead and try this game for size, worth every buck.

39090475.review:
This has to be one of the more unique settings for a game I've played. It's set in a universe where food was running short and monsters were taking over so they set up an institution of battle chefs who not only slay the monsters but then use them to create delicious cuisine. You play the part of an aspiring battle chef entering the tournament where the prize is becoming a member of the brigade so you need to beat various other chefs in cook offs, Iron Chef style, with the complication of you also have to go out and hunt for all of your ingredients and cook the meals within the set time limit.

Mechanics wise, both the combat and the cooking are relatively simple. It's the pretty basic combat style of spam attack for combos, you have a dodge with invisibility frames and a few special moves. The cooking is a match 3 game of 3 different coloured gems (flavour profiles) on a 4x4 grid representing the pot you're cooking in and rotating 2x2 squares (stirring) to match 3 gems. Matching 3 level 1 gems morphs them into a level 2 gem of the same flavour profile and likewise level 2 up to level 3. You get a ton of different equipment you earn over time and can use in the battles to interesting effects. There's a slow cooker than doesn't match any gems but simply very slowly upgrades what you put in it over time, there's a pot that only matches 4 level 1 gems but upgrades them to level 3 immediately, pots that match 2 gems to upgrade but only work on one specific flavour profile and so on. They do a really good job of varying the requirements to force you into using different equipments and bonuses for the tougher battles. Each battle you need to please up to 3 judges, each with their own preferred flavours and each battle requiring the use of a "theme ingredient" for the round or you suffer a heavy penalty.

The only real complaint I had about the gameplay is that there is one point that is just a completely absurd difficulty spike. All of a sudden the competitors are getting ridiculous scores, the time limit is lower and the theme ingredient is the toughest monsters on the map that can easily take up half your time just killing them for ingredients. After this it drops right back down again to where it was before, it's very odd, just came out of nowhere. I played on hard because I'd read it was recommended and this difficulty spike was the only time I ever took more than 2 attempts at a battle. The other issue is you go into the battle blind in terms of what the judges are after and what the theme ingredient is but if you lose you just have to rematch until you win and you can change your cooking loadout with the knowledge of the battle gained after your first attempt. Just makes it slightly irritating that they don't surface that before you choose your first loadout so you can end up going into a battle the first time around with absolutely nothing useful and really struggle.

I think it looks great too, all of the backgrounds are sort of this washed out watercolour style of art with the characters and monsters done in slightly bolder colours so they really stand out in the environments. They do the same with the match 3 gems which I like much less as they look very much like part of the "game" and not just part of the world like the rest. It makes sense that they've done it, it's obviously important for the match 3 game to be clear and concise so that you can execute it as quickly as you need to but it's just a bit of a shame it doesn't fit in with the art more. There's so many different dishes in the game, all represented as incredible looking plates of food and all determined by what combination of ingredients you actually put in the dish to create them too.

Lastly the story, which is good, if not a bit basic. The real interest for me was the characters who are excellently written and each have a back story that I wanted to learn more about. There's a part of the main game where you stop playing as the main protagonist and control one of the other characters and play out more of his story, which was completely out of the blue and out of place chronologically, which was initially confusing, but welcome all the same. I don't think I missed a single conversation opportunity playing through the game, I always wanted to talk to the various characters hanging around town - [b]9/10[/b]

38988777.review:
Heyo folks, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for Battle Chef Brigade by Trinket Studios and Adult Swim Games.

Battle Chef Brigade is an Iron Chef inspired cooking game that combines an RPG, Visual Novel and a Match 3 game. It’s a unique combination and it’s impressive how well each of the mechanics work together.

The story begins with you playing as a Battle Chef Brigade hopeful named Mina Han. She works in her family’s restaurant but she thirsts to learn more in the ways of cooking. So, she decides to run away from home to join the Battle Chef Brigade tournament in the hopes of being accepted into their ranks. To win, she must challenge other chefs to cooking battles Iron Chef style.

To win a chef battle, you must incorporate the required ingredient in the meal as well as include the Judge’s favorite magic element. Doing so will net you bonus points and make your meal that much more enjoyable to each judge. The game starts off easy with only one judge to please but as you progress you’ll eventually need to make 3 different meals for each judge. You must do this within the time limit as well.

To get ingredients for your various meals, you need to fight monsters using the game’s side scrolling beat ‘em up style combat system. The combat system feels very fluid and you can chain together combos easily. There’s a wide range of unique monsters for you to face during a battle and they each drop unique items to cook with.

There are a wide range of different cooking tools and sauces that you can utilize during a cooking battle as well. Sauces allow you to change the type of cooking gems you have in your food. Cooking tools include specialized pans, a slow cooker and frying pans to name only a few of them. These tools must be purchased from the shop in town.

To obtain money for the shop, you’ll need to take part in various part time jobs which act as mini-games in between battles. It’s highly recommended that you complete the part time jobs because they unlock new features in the game. There are 3 jobs to take part in. The first has you solving puzzles in order to unlock new cooking features, with the ultimate goal of acquiring ambrosia, the ultimate sauce. The second is based on the hunting of monsters and will allow you to acquire new combat abilities. And the third is a line cook job which has you cooking meals as quickly as possible.

To cook meals the game utilizes a match 3 style setup. The objective is to match 3 same colored cooking gems to create a more powerful version. This can be done twice until you have the best gem. The higher the level of the gem the more flavor you’ll get out of it. So, if you want to flavor it with fire, having level 3 flavor gems throughout will flavor it with fire. If you have a specialized cooking pot you can move your dish to that and you’ll be able to combine the specialized element with only 2 gems instead of 3. The slow cooker will also cook gems into higher level over time so it’s a good idea to use it when you head out to gather more cooking ingredients.

Overall, Battle Chef Brigade is an incredibly well put together game. From it’s well written and voiced story to its fun combat system and addicting cooking mechanics, the game has quickly become a favorite of mine. The game is a highly addictive experience and the cooking battles were pretty intense. Especially when you don’t know if you’re going to come out the victor or not. If you have any love for Iron Chef or even cooking themed games, then I highly recommend this game, it’s superb in every category.

If you're interest in checking out my full review or would simply like to see my final score, you can find the review here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/rpg/battle-chef-brigade-review

Thanks a lot for taking the time to read the review folks and happy gaming!
